Sequence Information.Peptide Name: EWAMP-R (Earthworm AMP arginine analog, Trp-rich; Arg-rich; Synthetic AMPs, UCLL1; BBMm)

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals this sequence is most similar (50%) toHorineR: 31%; W: 38%; G: 15%. GRAVY -1.51; M Wt: 1888.174; mol formula: C92H127N30O15; Mol Ex Coeff: 27750.Activity: active against E. coli ATCC 25922 and resitant strains (MIC 4.24-8.47 uM), S. aureus ATCC 29213 and MRSA (MIC 8.47-16.95 uM), E. faecalis ATCC 29212 and VRE (MIC 33.9 uM) anti-VRE, S. marcescens CGMCC 1.4256 (MIC 8.47 uM),  S. enterica subsp. enterica CGMCC 1.10754  (MIC 33.9 uM), E. cloacae CGMCC 1.2022 (MIC 67.79 uM),  Y. mollaretii CGMCC 1.6197 (MIC 33.9 uM), C. sakazakii CGMCC 1.6765 (MIC 8.47 uM), S. dysenteriae CGMCC 1.1869 (MIC 8.47 uM), P. aeruginosa CGMCC 1.10612 (MIC 67.79 uM), K. pneumoniae CKP1902 (MIC 33.9 uM), and A. baumannii CAB21 (MIC 16.95 uM).MOA: It permeabilized bacterial membranes. Peptide treatment also led to an increase in ROS.
Literature Information.Author: Wu Y, Deng S, Wang X, Thunders M, Qiu J, Li Y.2023
Literature Information.Title: Discovery and Mechanism of Action of a Novel Antimicrobial Peptide from an Earthworm.
